object.name: InputProfilePhotoAnimated
object.description: An animated profile photo in the MPEG4 format.
object.html_description: An animated profile photo in the MPEG4 format.
object.rst_description: An animated profile photo in the MPEG4 format.

annotations.description: Type of the profile photo, must be 'animated'
annotations.html_description: Type of the profile photo, must be “animated”
annotations.rst_description: Type of the profile photo, must be 'animated'
annotations.name: type

annotations.description: The animated profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files
annotations.html_description: The animated profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »
annotations.rst_description: The animated profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass 'attach://<file_attach_name>' if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. :ref:`More information on Sending Files Â» <sending-files>`
annotations.name: animation

annotations.description: Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static profile photo. Defaults to 0.0.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static profile photo. Defaults to 0.0.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static profile photo. Defaults to 0.0.
annotations.name: main_frame_timestamp
